DOC.brief_title: Senior Change Makers Study : Improving Physical Activity Environments
DOC.detailed_description: The propose study conduct six senior center San Diego , California involve 132 senior participant , 16 student participant , 12 decision maker participant ( N = 160 ) . Three senior center randomize advocacy program three randomized walk program . The participant advocacy intervention site undergo 8-week advocacy program ( 1 ) learn connection build environment physical activity , ( 2 ) conduct field audit physical activity environment use Microscale Audit Pedestrian Streetscapes ( MAPS ) Mini tool , ( 3 ) select advocacy issue relate physical activity barrier , ( 4 ) engage advocacy action , communicate decision maker public official . The group session include topic environment affect walk , potential pedestrian hazard solution , conduct audit walking environment , advocate , local example successful advocacy project , create advocacy action plan , create fact sheet advocacy issue , write letter representative , make advocacy presentation . The student participant work senior participant throughout program help accomplish advocacy goal . The program culminate presentation advocacy issue `` decision maker '' ( e.g. , city planner , engineer , city council member , etc. ) . In study condition , walk group , participant undergo 8-week program provide participant information safe physical activity , strategy increase physical activity , guide walk . The group sessions address topic benefit walk , fall prevention tip , goal setting , positive thinking , social support , sedentary behavior health , barrier walk , handle setback , overcome challenge physical activity . Comparing two beneficial program help participant recruitment retention , ensure between-group difference outcome due solely participation group program .
